segments.text: I notice the open window letting in that bright daylight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden beyond is tidy, with bushes lining the path.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Inside, though, the woman's completely zoned out on her dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's cascading from the sink like a waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's standing right in the flood but keeps drying away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me feel bad for her, missing all this chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's teetering on that stool, hand in the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister's looking up expectantly, palm out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're so innocent in their little theft.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the risks are heartbreakingâ€”the stool could give way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the wet floor just adds to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could warn them from here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene tugs at my heartstrings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast with the calm outside is poignant.
segments.speaker: PAR
